Abstract: This study explores the application of photoluminescence probes in data-enabled sensing, focusing on the integration of multidimensional fluorescence and phosphorescence techniques with advanced analytical methods. By leveraging multivariate and N-way analysis alongside sophisticated image analysis algorithms, we aim to enhance the sensitivity, specificity, and resolution of luminescent probes in complex environments. The research highlights the potential of these probes in providing detailed molecular information, facilitating the development of more accurate and efficient sensing platforms. Through a comprehensive review of recent advancements and case studies, we demonstrate the transformative impact of combining photoluminescent probes with data-driven analytical approaches, paving the way for innovative applications in environmental monitoring, biomedical diagnostics, and material science.
